title: Random Variables
crumbs: 2 Probability, random variables, probability distributions and simulations

title: Python
text:
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()







Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: Introduction
text:
Welcome to the website for TECH3 Applied Statistics. We will use this website as a supplement to lectures. The website is an ongoing development, so not all subjects will have content yet. Below you will find a detailed (preliminary) lecture plan, link to the textbook and curriculum.
